moves.1. d4:
please note that i will use these abbreviations : o-o or o-o-o = castling, !! = very good move, ! = good move, ?? = very bad move, ? = bad move, !? = may be good, may be bad.

to be in the middle.
moves.2. c4: to get him out of the middle.
moves.3. cxd5 Nxd5 4. e4: to be fully in the center.
moves.6. Be2: to get red of pinning and preparing for castling.
moves.10... O-O: early castling and getting red of the pinning. !
moves.11... Bxf3: he put me in a difficult choose, if i take with queen he will win pawn in d4, if i take gxf3 my pawns chine will be broken and  my king will be exposed.
moves.12. gxf3: i have chosen the second one.
moves.17... Nh4: his knight jumped to a good position. !
moves.18. Qd1: queen back to save pawn in f3.
moves.18... Qf6: black queen in an attacking position. !
moves.22... f5 23. Be2: to prevent the knight from jumping to f3.
moves.27... Nf5: i think this move is wrong, it will pin the knight. ?
moves.32... h5: attack to my bishop in the wrong time. ?
moves.34. Rxc6: capture a pawn and escape from the attack. !
moves.36. Kf1 Nxc3:
in this position i have 3 chooses :
 1. capturing the knight.
 2. capturing pawn in e6 by my rock with check.
 3. checking the king with my bishop in e4 and capture the rock.
moves.37. Be4+:
i have chosen the third one. !!

 at this position my opponent resigned.
 conclusion :
 1- my opponent is a good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes.
 2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will appreciate what i have done and may be the     beginners will learn some thing.

 friend of all mustafa
